page.title: 05Hatfield School.
page.content: {Hatfield School}was opened in 1953 in College Lane, in buildings which are now part of the{Hatfield Polytechnic.} It started as a Grammar school with 120 boys and girls (entrance was via exam),although it soon grew to about 900.The school was unusual as it offered German instead of Latin. Girls did needlework and cooking; boys did woodwork and metalwork.First year boys wore caps and shorts.The 1956 School Magazine reports enthusiastically of the third year ballroom dancing club! In 1971 the school moved to new premises in{Travellers Lane,}and at this time it became an all ability school.The{Hatfield Squash Club}is in the school grounds.Pupils make full use of it and squash is extremely popular.Many play successfully in the schools' league and at a higher level
